Have at Thee!

Blaze is the Ace of Aces. Not even Mobius One could take him down.

Blaze had a team behind him to help him earn his legend. Mobius 1 was feared by his enemies and pretty much worked by himself. Plus in operation Katana, Skyeye noted that his combat record as a single pilot was equal to that of 5 squadron

if we were to look at it in true terms of squadron it would be like this

A squadron is made of 4-5 flights. A single flight was made up of 4-8 pilots

so if we are going on that logic. A single squadron actual has anywhere between 16-40 pilots

so if Mobius 1 is equal to 5 ISAF squadrons he is equal to 80-200 pilots

just as a side note if we took this logic and assumed everyone in Mobius flight that took place in operation Judgement Day (aka attack on Megalith) had the same skill as Mobius 1 (just assuming), Mobuis flight had the skill equivalent to 640-1600 ISAF pilots.

Also we could go into the technological advances the f-22 has over the f-14 but that would take an entire wiki page

So who is the real Ace of Aces

In 1v1 Mobius 1 should crush Blaze

In 1v4 Blaze might stand a chance

Edited October 2, 2013 by War Eagle 1
Rules of engagement?

Rules of engagement?

1: Shoot first

2: Ask questions later

Rules of engagement?

-no ramming

-Fire by tonnage (lightest to heaviest)

-One missile/salvo per ship per turn

-No guided missiles

...Me and War Eagle decided we like these rules.

-no ramming

-Fire by tonnage (lightest to heaviest)

-One missile/salvo per ship per turn

-No guided missiles

...Me and War Eagle decided we like these rules.

Actually I use guided but I had it set for that mini match we did to truly test out experimental craft

Same with the single salvo

I've used multiple salvos against Spartwo if it didn't kill
